Package metricas

Class MetricHandler

java.lang.Object
metricas.MetricHandler
public class MetricHandler extends Object
MetricHandler is an object that will initialize all the processing related to code smelling. It will initialize the different Metric extended objects that exist and create the xlsx file that will contain all the stats gathered.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
Metric, CYCLO_method, LOC_class, LOC_method, NOM_class, WMC_class

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    MetricHandler()
    Constructs a MetricHandler object that hasn't been initialized.
    MetricHandler​(String projectDirectory)
    Constructs and initializes a MetricHandler object with a pointer to the directory of the project to be analyzed.

  • Constructor Details

    • MetricHandler

      public MetricHandler()
      Constructs a MetricHandler object that hasn't been initialized.

    • MetricHandler

      public MetricHandler​(String projectDirectory)
      Constructs and initializes a MetricHandler object with a pointer to the directory of the project to be analyzed.
      Parameters:
      projectDirectory - path to the directory of the project to be analyzed

  • Method Details

    • startMetricCounters

      public String startMetricCounters()
      Calls the openFolder(String dirPath) method that receives a String containing the path to the project to analyze and adds File objects to the filesInDirectory ArrayList that represents all the files to be analyzed. The it calls the result() method that returns a String containing the path to the xlsx file created with all the code smell metric analysis.
      Returns:
      a String containing the path to the xlsx file created
      See Also:
      openFolder(String), result()

    • createExcelFile

      public String createExcelFile()
      Creates all the objects necessary to create a xlsx file and calls the methods createHeaderExcel(XSSFSheet sheet) and exportResults(XSSFSheet sheet) that will fill the sheet object with all the metric analysis. Then proceeds to save the new xlsx file and returns a String containing the path to the xlsx file created.
      Returns:
      a String containing the path to the xlsx file created
      See Also:
      createHeaderExcel(XSSFSheet), exportResults(XSSFSheet), XSSFWorkbook, XSSFSheet

    • createHeaderExcel

      public void createHeaderExcel​(org.apache.poi.xssf.usermodel.XSSFSheet sheet)
      Adds to the sheet object the header of the future xlsx file, containing the cells "MethodID", "Package", "Class", "Method" and all the metric and rule names.
      Parameters:
      sheet - XSSFSheet object that will be filled with the metrics stats
      See Also:
      XSSFWorkbook, XSSFSheet

    • writeExcel

      public void writeExcel​(org.apache.poi.xssf.usermodel.XSSFSheet sheet, String[] line)
      Fills the sheet object with all the stats from the line parameter.
      Parameters:
      sheet - XSSFSheet object that will be filled with the metrics stats
      line - String[] array that contains all the stats to add to the sheet object
      See Also:
      XSSFWorkbook, XSSFSheet

    • openFolder

      public void openFolder​(String dirPath)
      Creates a File object with the project directory path and calls the method listFilesForFolder(File folder). This is done so the method listFilesForFolder(File folder) can be recursive.
      Parameters:
      dirPath - String with the path to the directory containing the project to analyze
      See Also:
      listFilesForFolder(File)

    • cutAbsolutePath

      public String cutAbsolutePath​(String absolutePath)
      Does String manipulation to turn the full path of a file to just the package and class separated by a forward slash (/). e.g. pkg/cls
      Parameters:
      absolutePath - String containing the path of a file inside the project directory
      Returns:
      the package and class of the specified file separated by a forward slash (/)

    • addRule

      public void addRule​(Rule rule)
      Adds a new Rule object to the rules ArrayList
      Parameters:
      rule - new Rule object to the rules ArrayList

    • addRules

      public void addRules​(List<Rule> rules)
      Adds multiple Rule objects to the rules ArrayList
      Parameters:
      rules - List of new Rule objects to add to the rules ArrayList

    • getFilesInDirectory

      Returns:
      the global variable ArrayList<File> filesInDirecory
